channel.title: Microservice Configurations on
channel.description: Recent content in Microservice Configurations on

item.title: Create Microservice Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to create a microservice configuration.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Configurations in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Create on the page.

  4. In the Create Microservice Configuration dialog, set the parameters for the microservice configuration, and then click Create.

    Parameter Description

    Name

item.title: View Microservice Configuration List
item.description:
This section describes how to view the microservice configuration list.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Viewing permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Viewing permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Configurations in the left navigation pane.

    • The microservice configuration list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: View Microservice Configuration Details
item.description:
This section describes how to view the microservice configuration details.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Viewing permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Viewing permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Configurations in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click the name of a microservice configuration in the list to open its details page.

    • The Attributes area on the left side of the details page displays the project, cluster, and creation time of the microservice configuration.

    • The Data tab on the right side of the details page displays the data contained in the microservice configuration.

item.title: Edit Microservice Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to edit a microservice configuration.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Configurations in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the microservice configuration you want to edit, and then select Edit from the drop-down list.

  4. In the Edit Microservice Configuration dialog, set the new data for the microservice configuration, and then click OK.

item.title: Replicate Microservice Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to replicate a microservice configuration.

You can use an existing microservice configuration to create a new microservice configuration with a different name but identical data.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Configurations in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the microservice configuration you want to operate, and then select Replicate from the drop-down list.

  4. In the Replicate Microservice Configuration dialog, set the name of the new microservice configuration, and then click OK.

    Note

    You can also modify the configuration data as needed.

item.title: Roll Back Microservice Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to roll back a microservice configuration.

Each edit of the microservice configuration generates a revision record, which you can use to roll back the microservice configuration to a historical version.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

item.title: Delete Microservice Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to delete a microservice configuration.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Delete a Single Microservice Configuration

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Configurations in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the microservice configuration you want to delete, and then select Delete from the drop-down list.

  4. In the Delete Microservice Configuration dialog, enter the name of the microservice configuration, and then click OK.
